featured.text: Nowadays, on April Fools’ Day, people often 19 to create elaborate hoaxes to fool others.
But the young man who had made a fool of himself at the meeting was not on the list.
Newspapers, radio and TV stations, and websites have participated in the April 1 tradition of making 20 reports in order to fool their audiences.
Recent experiments with this device showed that 80% of the participants were fooled by the smell.
Other people began to make fun of these traditionalists, sending them on “fool’s errands” or trying to fool them into believing something false.

definition.en_def: A person who acts unwisely or imprudently; a silly person.
definition.example: He felt like a fool for believing the lie.
